name: internally
content:
internally adverb
(INSIDE PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 in a way that exists or happens inside the body: This medicine is for external use only and should not be taken internally. He was bleeding internally.
in a way that exists or happens within a person's mind: What I did was symbolic of how I was feeling internally.
More examplesFewer examplesCastor oil can be used internally as a laxative as well as on the skin.If melanoma spreads internally, there is little that can be done.It may have looked like easy success but I was struggling so much internally.She was internally burnt out and exhausted.

internally adverb
(INSIDE OBJECT)
in a way that happens in or relates to the inside of an object or building: The tank had corroded internally. The library now looks much better both externally and internally.
More examplesFewer examplesWe spent three weeks painting the house internally and recarpeting it.The block was shabby, but internally the flat had been well maintained.an internally illuminated sign

internally adverb
(WITHIN ORGANIZATION)
in a way that happens or remains within an organization: The job was advertised internally. Although internally divided, the party presented a united front.
in a way that relates to or stays within one country: You still need photo ID even if you're flying internally.
More examplesFewer examplesWhy pay for outside consultants when you can get the work done internally?We use our own internally devised testing procedures.The company moved to using more standard off-the-shelf software applications, rather than internally developed systems.We did have a few problems internally within the organization.Every nation wants to resolve its problems internally.a camp for internally displaced people
